messages: 77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:00): Hm..  my class/ID names are never more than two words anyway.

d387aed09998cfa491e07a33df71de13 (02:00): I prefer -, I hate underscores
9fcc1a77a33574c65eadb13219a859a3 (02:00): only thing i dont like about _ is sometimes when i am sshed in, it can be hard to see
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (02:00): although with my nav, I had to add <li id="home-">
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (02:01): I used home already :p
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:01): I'm always afraid that - is going to cause some strange problem in a browser
c95720c193df40ce1618d1b00b040b42 (02:01): html id: http://www.w3.org/TR/html401/struct/global.html#h-7.5.2
3d2d800163bd186050b12164fd979515 (02:01): Ill replace it with a 0 then

d387aed09998cfa491e07a33df71de13 (02:02): 'ID and NAME tokens must begin with a letter ([A-Za-z]) and may be followed by any number of letters, digits ([0-9]), hyphens ("-"), underscores ("_"), colons (":"), and periods (".").'
9fcc1a77a33574c65eadb13219a859a3 (02:02): Riyonuk: use a O :)
6735c9ab9b1ac69d7d2f449177128eca (02:02): yes, but that doesn't make them all a good idea

cd67b0f3449fd28a8ca668f003b3b78a (02:02): Hi all, my site displays fine on firefox, but in ie the text overlays the images  - I'm assuming its an incorrect setting in the stylesheet but i cant seem to see where

cd67b0f3449fd28a8ca668f003b3b78a (02:09): but if i use a clear:both command, it will not display the post until the left and right sidebars have been cleared
850a2e5c449637a6893fabbd39d2c502 (02:09): I'm sooooo tired of going "wohoo it's like I want it!", then look in IE and get this overwhelming sorrow...

cd67b0f3449fd28a8ca668f003b3b78a (02:10): images

cd67b0f3449fd28a8ca668f003b3b78a (02:10): but maybe its seeing them as background images for some reason

32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:40): I would like my TABLE of numeric values to have 'bars' in the background graphically representing the numeric values...in other words, a combination of data table and graph in the same location (see http://dashboardspy.com/img/excel-12-dashboard.jpg) ... any idea how I can do that?

32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:41): I try to put a numeric value as well as a DIV with some background and width into a table cell, however I can't get the numeric value to appear on stop of the div (I set divs' float: left)...

77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:41): falconair: Not sure if this would work, but it's the only thing I've seen close to what you want: http://meyerweb.com/eric/thoughts/2005/12/20/bar-graphs-with-style/

32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:45): riczho: the example you gave seems to be a straight bar graph, I have that working already....now I need to display a simple table of numeric values...but add a faint 'bar' representing the value in the table cell...so on a very quick glance one can compare the values visually, but on closer inspection read the actual numbers in all their floating point glory...
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:45): Hmm..  /me isn't too sure, then.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:46): Whoops..  that's a bad habit.

32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:47): i'm not css guru so I tried taking a simple TABLE and adding a 'float:left' div to the cell, hoping that the div would be sort of a 'background' for the numeric value, that's what I can't get, i see the div and next to it i see the numeric value...how can I get the two to exist in the same space rather than take up space as block units?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:48): Although that still wouldn't be the nicest.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:48): Actually, (personally), I'd prefer a separate graph next to the table.
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:49): I like *simple* data presentation.
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:49): hm...i'm trying to avoid using images, it should be possible to do it all with css & html (& javascrip)
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:50): Um..  a graph should be an image.
32275c7eba5818fe477098fe5865acf9 (02:51): the bars in my graphs are represented as DIV with a certain color and height/width
5c1d3d557f9061881e63b46269bb2dba (02:54): QUAD SLI QUAD SLI!!!!! ITS HERE!!!! :D
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:56): falconair: Think about it this way: The point of semantic markup is that people that just see the markup can still see the page properly, right?
77194253ee065122d06a4a8fecbc35bd (02:56): falconair: And that is precisely why a graph should be represented as an image, given the capabilities of HTML.
f490695b84c6265d5576830c8900f98e (02:58): is there a way to create a "stairs effect", so <div id="nav_stairs"><div class="newlevel">asd</div>[...]</div> where each newlevel is indented by +15px?
5c1d3d557f9061881e63b46269bb2dba (02:58): position:relative
